article_title: Seniors, owner at odds over low-income apartments
article_text:
Affordable rents

The Department of Housing and Urban Development lays out clear guidelines for the maximum rent a developer can charge in a building financed by tax credits. The rent c...

article_metadata.description: WARWICK – Life’s been tough for Elise Schaeffer since she lost her job as a telephone operator 12 years ago. She stocked packages in a warehouse to make ends meet, worked at MacDonald’s, took any job that paid the bills.Seven years ago, she moved to Liberty Green 1, a low-income apartment building for seniors in the Village of Warwick. Now 64, she subsists on Social Security Disability benefits of $1,080, supplemented by working six hours a week as a crossing guard for the
article_metadata.author: Hema Easley
